intro: Eugenia itatiaiensis, commonly known as the Brazilian cherry or pitanga, is a species of flowering plant in the Myrtaceae family. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its small, glossy, dark red to black berries. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are elliptical,革质 (leathery), and have a distinctive aromatic scent. The fruit is not only ornamental but also has traditional medicinal uses in some cultures.
